image_analysis.description: A black and white scan of a two-page spread from a printed book. The left page is numbered 152 and the right page is 153. The book's binding is visible in the center, causing some text to be obscured and the pages to curve. A document control number is stamped at the bottom of the image.
image_analysis.layout: Two-column layout, corresponding to two pages of a book. Page 152 is on the left, and page 153 is on the right. Each page has a header, a main body of text, and a page number at the bottom. There is a document identifier at the very bottom of the image frame.

152

CHAPTER 39

Todd Meister: June 2015

Harry Cipriani, on Fifth Avenue, is a New York institu-
tion. The restaurant began its life as an American out-
post of Harry’s Bar—which was itself a famous American
outpost in Venice. Located inside the Sherry-Netherland hotel,
it’s a theme restaurant—the theme being money. And today, a
hedge-fund manager named Todd Meister is talking about a very
wealthy man—Jeffrey Epstein—whom he knows through his
father, Epstein’s sometime friend Bob Meister.
“I’ve known Jeffrey since I was nineteen,” Meister says. “So
let me tell you what I know—whatever everyone knows and
everybody else says. First off, he’s no billionaire. Second off—
and here’s why—he has no clue how to invest. He has people do
that for him.”
Meister knows how to invest. He does it for other people and, as
the son of a superrich father, for himself. He also knows about the

document_metadata.subject: An interview or account by Todd Meister regarding Jeffrey Epstein, dated June 2015.

notes: The image is a scan of two pages from a book, identified as pages 152 and 153. The text on the left page is partially cut off by the edge of the scan. The document has a Bates stamp 'HOUSE_OVERSIGHT_010496' at the bottom, indicating it is part of a collection of documents, likely from the House Oversight Committee.
